title: Whispers in the Rain
description: A collection of interconnected short stories that weave together themes of love, loss, and redemption. Set against the backdrop of monsoon rains in contemporary India, these narratives explore the human condition with sensitivity and depth. Each story stands alone yet contributes to a larger tapestry of human experience.

reviews.text: A masterful collection that captures the complexity of human relationships with poetic precision.
Sankar's prose flows like the monsoon rains she describes, bringing life and renewal to every page.
An exceptional debut that establishes Sankar as a voice to watch in contemporary literature.

title: The Magic Garden
description: A delightful story about friendship, courage, and the magic that exists in everyday life. When young Maya discovers a hidden garden behind her grandmother's house, she embarks on an adventure that teaches her valuable lessons about trust, kindness, and believing in the impossible. Perfect for children aged 6-10.

reviews.text: A charming tale that will capture the imagination of young readers and remind adults of the wonder in simple things.
Sankar's gentle storytelling and vivid descriptions create a world that children will want to visit again and again.

title: The Burnings
description: A gothic horror novel that explores the dark corners of human nature and the supernatural. Set in a decaying mansion on the outskirts of a small town, the story follows the investigation of mysterious fires that seem to have a mind of their own. As the protagonist delves deeper into the mystery, they uncover secrets that challenge their understanding of reality.

reviews.text: A spine-chilling tale that masterfully blends psychological horror with supernatural elements.
Sankar proves her versatility with this atmospheric horror novel that keeps readers on the edge of their seats.
